channel.title: Java Arrays (Help needed)
channel.description:
This: http://java.sun.com/docs/books/tutorial/java/nutsandbolts/arrays.html
I just want to clarify something about arrays. [code]int[] anArray = {100, 200, 300, 400, 500, 600, 700, 800, 900, 1000};[/code]
How do I apply it for random rewards on chests? I know that's possible but I don't know how to. Help please. :)

item.title: Java Arrays (Help needed)
item.dc:creator: @Rixxx Rix_
item.description:
@Rixxx wrote:

Thanks man. This will come in handy next time.

Read full topic

item.title: Java Arrays (Help needed)
item.dc:creator: @relmitos relmitos
item.description:
@relmitos wrote:

In the array you have to declare which rewards you want the chest to give.
You can rename the array to whatever you want, just make sure you change the name in the return statement aswell.

This method just picks a random number from inside the array:

public int aReward(){
    return anArray[(int) (Math.random() * anArray.length)];
}

Read full topic

item.title: Java Arrays (Help needed)
item.dc:creator: @Rixxx Rix_
item.description:
@Rixxx wrote:

So does that mean I’ll have to stick with this? Can I rename the arrays?

int[] anArray = {100, 200, 300, 400, 500, 600, 700, 800, 900, 1000};

Read full topic

item.title: Java Arrays (Help needed)
item.dc:creator: @relmitos relmitos
item.description:
@relmitos wrote:

Call it with random().

int[] anArray = {100, 200, 300, 400, 500, 600, 700, 800, 900, 1000};

public int aReward(){
    return anArray[(int) (Math.random() * anArray.length)];
}

And call this under an object’s clicking packet: aReward();

For example, in parseIncomingPackets():

case 132:
    if(objectClicked == 13){
        addItem(aReward());
    }
    break;

Read full topic
